intro: Xylobium concavum, commonly known as the concave xylobium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in the summer months. Xylobium concavum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of its family, with unique adaptations to its ecological niche.
